Part and Partial Correlations

Zero-order, part and partial correlations

correlations(model)

Arguments

model
an object of class lm

Value

correlations returns an object of class "correlations". An object of class "correlations" is a data frame containing the following components:

Details

correlations returns the relative importance of independent variables in determining response variable. How much each variable uniquely contributes to rsquare over and above that which can be accounted for by the other predictors? Zero order correlation is the Pearson correlation coefficient between the dependent variable and the independent variables. Part correlations indicates how much rsquare will decrease if that variable is removed from the model and partial correlations indicates amount of variance in response variable, which is not estimated by the other independent variables in the model, but is estimated by the specific variable.

Examples

model <- lm(mpg ~ disp + hp + wt + qsec, data = mtcars)
correlations(model)
#>                Correlations                 
#> -------------------------------------------
#> Variable    Zero Order    Partial     Part  
#> -------------------------------------------
#> disp            -0.848     -0.048    -0.019 
#> hp              -0.776     -0.224    -0.093 
#> wt              -0.868     -0.574    -0.285 
#> qsec             0.419      0.219     0.091 
#> -------------------------------------------
